Burgundy wine.label: Burgundy wine
Burgundy wine.description: Burgundy wine is wine made in the Burgundy region in eastern France, in the valleys and slopes west of the Saône River, a tributary of the Rhône. Wikipedia

Côtes du Rhône AOC.label: Côtes du Rhône AOC
Côtes du Rhône AOC.description: Côtes du Rhône is a wine-growing Appellation d'Origine Contrôlée for the Rhône wine region of France, which may be used throughout the region, also in those areas which are covered by other AOCs. Wikipedia

Crozes-Hermitage AOC.label: Crozes-Hermitage AOC
Crozes-Hermitage AOC.description: Crozes-Hermitage is a French wine Appellation d'Origine Contrôlée in the northern Rhône wine region of France. Wikipedia

Palatinate (wine region).label: Palatinate
Palatinate (wine region).description: Palatinate is a German wine-growing region in the area of Bad Dürkheim, Neustadt an der Weinstraße, and Landau in Rhineland-Palatinate. Before 1993, it was known as Rhine Palatinate. Wikipedia

Côte Chalonnaise.label: Côte Chalonnaise
Côte Chalonnaise.description: Côte Chalonnaise is a subregion of the Burgundy wine region of France. Côte Chalonnaise lies to the south of the Côte d'Or continuing the same geology southward. Wikipedia

Eastern Townships.label: Eastern Townships
Eastern Townships.description: The Eastern Townships is a tourist region and a former administrative region in southeastern Quebec situated between the former seigneuries south of the Saint Lawrence River and the United States border. Wikipedia

Alta Mesa AVA.label: Alta Mesa AVA
Alta Mesa AVA.description: The Alta Mesa AVA is an American Viticultural Area entirely located within the Lodi AVA in Sacramento County, California in the United States. Wikipedia

Altus AVA.label: Altus AVA
Altus AVA.description: The Altus AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in northwest Arkansas near the town of Altus in Franklin County. Wikipedia

Applegate Valley AVA.label: Applegate Valley AVA
Applegate Valley AVA.description: The Applegate Valley AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in southern Oregon. It is entirely contained within the Rogue Valley AVA, which is itself included within the larger Southern Oregon AVA. Wikipedia

Bergerac wine.label: Bergerac wine-growing region
Bergerac wine.description: The Bergerac wine-growing region is a subregion of South West France, is located around the town of Bergerac in the Dordogne department, and comprises 93 communes. Wikipedia

Central Coast AVA.label: Central Coast AVA
Central Coast AVA.description: The Central Coast AVA is a large American Viticultural Area that spans from Santa Barbara County in the south to the San Francisco Bay Area in the north. The boundaries of the Central Coast include portions of six counties. Wikipedia

Borden Ranch AVA.label: Borden Ranch AVA
Borden Ranch AVA.description: The Borden Ranch AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in both Sacramento County and San Joaquin County, California. It is part of the larger Lodi AVA. Wikipedia

Chalk Hill AVA.label: Chalk Hill
Chalk Hill AVA.description: The Chalk Hill AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in Sonoma County, California. The boundaries of the wine appellation cover the northeast corner of the Russian River Valley AVA. Wikipedia

Columbia Gorge AVA.label: Columbia Gorge AVA
Columbia Gorge AVA.description: The Columbia Gorge AVA is an American Viticultural Area which includes land surrounding the Columbia River Gorge, straddling the border between Oregon and Washington. Wikipedia

Condrieu AOC.label: Condrieu AOC
Condrieu AOC.description: Condrieu is a French wine-growing Appellation d'Origine Contrôlée located in the northern Rhône wine, near Vienne and to the south of the Côte-Rôtie AOC. Wikipedia

Covelo AVA.label: Covelo AVA
Covelo AVA.description: The Covelo AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in northern Mendocino County, California. Although the region only has 2 acres under vine, it was granted AVA status by the United States Department ... Wikipedia

Cornas AOC.label: Cornas AOC
Cornas AOC.description: Cornas is a French wine Appellation d'Origine Contrôlée in the northern Rhône wine region of France south of Lyon. It is one of the smallest appellations in the Rhône valley and produces only red wine, from the Syrah grape. Wikipedia

Edna Valley AVA.label: Edna Valley AVA
Edna Valley AVA.description: The Edna Valley AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in San Luis Obispo County, California south of the city of San Luis Obispo and north of the town of Arroyo Grande. It is part of the larger Central Coast AVA. Wikipedia

Fennville AVA.label: Fennville AVA
Fennville AVA.description: The Fennville AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in Allegan County, Michigan. Entirely contained within the larger Lake Michigan Shore AVA, the Fennville AVA borders Lake Michigan on the west, ... Wikipedia

Eola-Amity Hills AVA.label: Eola-Amity Hills AVA
Eola-Amity Hills AVA.description: The Eola-Amity Hills AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in Polk County and Yamhill County, Oregon. It is entirely contained within the Willamette Valley AVA, and stretches from the city of Amity in the north to Salem in the south. Wikipedia

Chalone AVA.label: Chalone
Chalone AVA.description: The Chalone AVA is an American Viticultural Area in the Monterey and San Benito counties of California, located in the Gabilan Mountains east of Soledad. The 8,640 acres region is named for the nearby Chalone peaks. Wikipedia

Fredericksburg in the Texas Hill Country.label: Fredericksburg in the Texas Hill Country AVA
Fredericksburg in the Texas Hill Country.description: The Fredericksburg in the Texas Hill Country AVA is an American Viticultural Area surrounding the town of Fredericksburg, Texas in the Texas Hill Country. Wikipedia

Hudson River Region AVA.label: Hudson River Region AVA
Hudson River Region AVA.description: The Hudson River Region AVA is an American Viticultural Area around the Hudson River in eastern New York. The region is home to the oldest continuously operating winery in North America, the Brotherhood Winery, established in 1839. Wikipedia

High Valley AVA.label: High Valley AVA
High Valley AVA.description: High Valley AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in the eastern part of Lake County, California. Wikipedia

Jahant AVA.label: Jahant AVA
Jahant AVA.description: The Jahant AVA is an American Viticultural Area located within the Lodi AVA. Most of the AVA is located within San Joaquin County, California, with a small part in Sacramento County. Wikipedia

Long Island AVA.label: Long Island AVA
Long Island AVA.description: The Long Island AVA is an American Viticultural Area encompassing Nassau and Suffolk counties of New York, including the smaller offshore islands in those counties. Wikipedia

Lirac AOC.label: Lirac AOC
Lirac AOC.description: Lirac is a wine-growing Appellation d'Origine Contrôlée in the department of Gard situated in the low hills along the right bank of the Rhône river in the southern Rhône wine region of France. It is named after the village of Lirac. Wikipedia

Madera AVA.label: Madera AVA
Madera AVA.description: The Madera AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in both Fresno County and Madera County, in central California. Wikipedia

Mâconnais.label: Mâconnais
Mâconnais.description: The Mâconnais district is located in the south of the Burgundy wine region in France, west of the Saône river. It takes its name from the town of Mâcon. Wikipedia

Martha's Vineyard AVA.label: Martha's Vineyard AVA
Martha's Vineyard AVA.description: The Martha's Vineyard AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in Dukes County, Massachusetts, including all of the land on the islands named Martha's Vineyard and Chappaquiddick Island. Wikipedia

Missouri wine.label: Missouri wine
Missouri wine.description: Missouri Wine refers to wine made from grapes grown in the U.S. state of Missouri. German immigrants in the early-to-mid-19th century, founded the wine industry in Missouri, resulting in its wine corridor being called the Missouri "Rhineland". Wikipedia

Mount Harlan AVA.label: Mount Harlan AVA
Mount Harlan AVA.description: The Mt. Harlan AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in San Benito County, California. It is located in the Gabilan Mountains and is part of the larger Central Coast AVA. Wikipedia

Mount Veeder AVA.label: Mount Veeder AVA
Mount Veeder AVA.description: Mount Veeder AVA is an American Viticultural Area located within Napa Valley AVA among the Mayacamas Mountains. The boundaries of this appellation include 25 square miles with 1,000 acres planted on thin volcanic soil. Wikipedia

Northern Sonoma AVA.label: Northern Sonoma AVA
Northern Sonoma AVA.description: The Northern Sonoma AVA is an American Viticultural Area in Sonoma County, California, USA. The appellation covers most of the county with the notable exceptions of the Los Carneros AVA and Sonoma Valley ... Wikipedia

North Coast AVA.label: North Coast
North Coast AVA.description: The North Coast AVA is an American Viticultural Area in the state of California that encompasses grape-growing regions in six counties located north of San Francisco Lake, Marin, Mendocino, Napa, Sonoma, and Solano. Wikipedia

Oak Knoll District of Napa Valley AVA.label: Oak Knoll District
Oak Knoll District of Napa Valley AVA.description: The Oak Knoll District of Napa Valley AVA is an American Viticultural Area located within Napa Valley AVA at the southern end of the valley floor. Wikipedia

Oregon wine.label: Oregon wine
Oregon wine.description: The state of Oregon in the United States has established an international reputation for its production of wine. Wikipedia

Red Mountain AVA.label: Red Mountain AVA
Red Mountain AVA.description: The Red Mountain AVA is an American Viticultural Area that includes the land surrounding Red Mountain in Benton County, Washington. It is part of the Yakima Valley AVA, which in turn is part of the larger Columbia Valley AVA. Wikipedia

Potter Valley AVA.label: Potter Valley AVA
Potter Valley AVA.description: The Potter Valley AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in northern Mendocino County, California centered around town of Potter Valley. Wikipedia

Ramona Valley AVA.label: Ramona Valley AVA
Ramona Valley AVA.description: The Ramona Valley AVA is an American Viticultural Area located 28 miles northeast of the city of San Diego in San Diego County, California centered around the city of Ramona. Wikipedia

Red Hills Lake County AVA.label: Red Hills Lake County
Red Hills Lake County AVA.description: The Red Hills Lake County AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in Lake County, California. The wine region lies along the southwestern shores of Clear Lake, separating Excelsior Valley to the east from Big Valley to the west. Wikipedia

Saddle Rock-Malibu AVA.label: Saddle Rock-Malibu AVA
Saddle Rock-Malibu AVA.description: The Saddle Rock-Malibu AVA is an American Viticultural Area in Los Angeles County, California. The region was once part of the 200,000 acres Saddle Rock Ranch, created from the original Spanish Land Grant. Wikipedia

San Antonio Valley AVA.label: San Antonio Valley AVA
San Antonio Valley AVA.description: The San Antonio Valley AVA is an American Viticultural Area centered around San Antonio Valley in Monterey County, California. Wikipedia

San Bernabe AVA.label: San Bernabe AVA
San Bernabe AVA.description: The San Bernabe AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in southern Monterey County, California. It is part of the larger Monterey AVA. San Bernabe is located between the Salinas River on the east, and the Santa Lucia Mountains on the west. Wikipedia

San Ysidro District AVA.label: San Ysidro District AVA
San Ysidro District AVA.description: The San Ysidro District AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in Santa Clara County, California. It is part of the larger Santa Clara Valley AVA and is located in the foothills of the Diablo Range. Wikipedia

Santa Clara Valley AVA.label: Santa Clara Valley
Santa Clara Valley AVA.description: The Santa Clara Valley AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in Santa Clara County, California. The area served an important role in the early history of California wine and was home to the pioneer winemakers Paul Masson and Charles Lefranc. Wikipedia

Santa Cruz Mountains AVA.label: Santa Cruz Mountains AVA
Santa Cruz Mountains AVA.description: The Santa Cruz Mountains AVA is an American Viticultural Area centered around the Santa Cruz Mountains. It includes three counties in California Santa Clara, Santa Cruz and San Mateo. Wikipedia

Snake River Valley AVA.label: Snake River Valley AVA
Snake River Valley AVA.description: The Snake River Valley AVA in an American Viticultural Area that encompasses an area in Southwestern Idaho and two counties in eastern Oregon. Wikipedia

Solano County Green Valley AVA.label: Solano County Green Valley AVA
Solano County Green Valley AVA.description: The Solano County Green Valley AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in Solano County, California. Located southeast of the Napa Valley AVA, Green Valley is about 1 mile long and 4 miles long. Wikipedia

Sonoita AVA.label: Sonoita AVA
Sonoita AVA.description: The Sonoita AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in southeast Arizona, south of the city of Tucson. Wikipedia

Southeastern New England AVA.label: Southeastern New England AVA
Southeastern New England AVA.description: The Southeastern New England AVA is an American Viticultural Area that includes portions of thirteen counties in three New England states Connecticut, Massachusetts, and Rhode Island. Wikipedia

South Coast AVA.label: South Coast AVA
South Coast AVA.description: The South Coast AVA is an American Viticultural Area in the state of California that encompasses grape-growing regions in five counties of Southern California Los Angeles, Orange, Riverside, San Bernardino, and San Diego. Wikipedia

St. Helena AVA.label: St. Helena AVA
St. Helena AVA.description: The St. Helena AVA is an American Viticultural Area located within Napa Valley, centered around the town of St. Helena, California. Wikipedia

Tavel AOC.label: Tavel AOC
Tavel AOC.description: Tavel is a wine-growing Appellation d'Origine Contrôlée in the southern Rhône wine region of France, across the Rhône River from Châteauneuf-du-Pape AOC and just north of Avignon. Wikipedia

Temecula Valley AVA.label: Temecula Valley AVA
Temecula Valley AVA.description: The Temecula Valley AVA is an American Viticultural Area in southern Riverside County, California. Wikipedia

Walla Walla Valley AVA.label: Walla Walla Valley AVA
Walla Walla Valley AVA.description: The Walla Walla Valley AVA is an American Viticultural Area located within Washington State and extending partly into the northeastern corner of Oregon. The wine region is entirely included within the larger Columbia Valley AVA. Wikipedia

Tracy Hills AVA.label: Tracy Hills AVA
Tracy Hills AVA.description: The Tracy Hills AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in both San Joaquin County and Stanislaus County, California. Wikipedia

Willow Creek AVA.label: Willow Creek AVA
Willow Creek AVA.description: The Willow Creek AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in the Humboldt and Trinity counties of northern California, near the town of Willow Creek. Wikipedia

Ahr (wine region).label: Ahr
Ahr (wine region).description: Ahr is a wine region for quality wine in Germany, and is located in the valley of the river Ahr, a tributary of Rhine, and is situated in the federal state of Rhineland-Palatinate. Wikipedia

Côtes du Rhône.label: Côtes du Rhône AOC
Côtes du Rhône.description: Côtes du Rhône is a wine-growing Appellation d'Origine Contrôlée for the Rhône wine region of France, which may be used throughout the region, also in those areas which are covered by other AOCs. Wikipedia

Ajaccio AOC.label: Ajaccio AOC
Ajaccio AOC.description: Ajaccio is an Appellation d'Origine Contrôlée for wine situated in Corsica, France as a part of the Corsica wine region. Ajaccio was earlier known as Coteaux d'Ajaccio and covers a vast stretch of land that looks down over the Mediterranean Sea. Wikipedia

Alexander Valley AVA.label: Alexander Valley AVA
Alexander Valley AVA.description: The Alexander Valley is a Californian American Viticultural Area just north of Healdsburg in Sonoma County. It is home to many wineries and vineyards, as well as the city of Cloverdale. It is the largest and most fully planted wine region in Sonoma. Wikipedia

Dunnigan Hills AVA.label: Dunnigan Hills AVA
Dunnigan Hills AVA.description: The Dunnigan Hills AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in the Dunnigan Hills, in Yolo County, California. Wikipedia

Alexandria Lakes AVA.label: Alexandria Lakes AVA
Alexandria Lakes AVA.description: The Alexandria Lakes AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in Douglas County, Minnesota, near the city of Alexandria. Alexandria Lakes was the first AVA to be created in Minnesota. Wikipedia

Anderson Valley AVA.label: Anderson Valley
Anderson Valley AVA.description: The Anderson Valley AVA is an American Viticultural Area centered on the Anderson Valley in Mendocino County, California. It is known primarily for its Pinot noir and sparkling wine production. Wikipedia

Arroyo Grande Valley AVA.label: Arroyo Grande Valley
Arroyo Grande Valley AVA.description: The Arroyo Grande Valley AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in San Luis Obispo County, California. It is part of the larger Central Coast AVA. Wikipedia

Arroyo Seco AVA.label: Arroyo Seco AVA
Arroyo Seco AVA.description: The Arroyo Seco AVA is an American Viticultural Area in Monterey County, California, southeast of Monterey Bay. The appellation encompasses 18,240 acres in the valley adjacent to the Arroyo Seco Creek. Wikipedia

Atlas Peak AVA.label: Atlas Peak
Atlas Peak AVA.description: The Atlas Peak AVA is an American Viticultural Area located within Napa Valley AVA just northeast of the city of Napa. Wikipedia

Augusta AVA.label: Augusta AVA
Augusta AVA.description: The Augusta AVA was the first federally approved American Viticultural Area gaining the status on June 20, 1980, eight months before the Napa Valley AVA in northern California. Wikipedia

Bell Mountain AVA.label: Bell Mountain AVA
Bell Mountain AVA.description: The Bell Mountain AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in Gillespie County, Texas. It was the first designated wine area located entirely in the state of Texas, and covers an area of over 3,200 acres. Wikipedia

Ben Lomond Mountain AVA.label: Ben Lomond Mountain AVA
Ben Lomond Mountain AVA.description: The Ben Lomond Mountain AVA is an American Viticultural Area in Santa Cruz County, California, located on the western edge of the Santa Cruz Mountains. Wikipedia

Benmore Valley AVA.label: Benmore Valley AVA
Benmore Valley AVA.description: The Benmore Valley AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in southwestern Lake County, California. The valley is named for Benjamin Moore, a local 19th century cattle rustler. Wikipedia

Arkansas Mountain AVA.label: Arkansas Mountain AVA
Arkansas Mountain AVA.description: The Arkansas Mountain AVA is an American Viticultural Area located in the Ozark Mountains of northwestern Arkansas. It is part of the larger Ozark Mountain AVA, which also includes regions in Missouri and Oklahoma. Wikipedia

Antelope Valley of the California High D.label: Antelope Valley of the California High Desert AVA
Antelope Valley of the California High D.description: The Antelope Valley of the California High Desert AVA is an American Viticultural Area north of Los Angeles. The AVA is near the Sierra Pelona Valley AVA and the Leona Valley AVA. Wikipedia
